definitions.definition: very small drops of a liquid that are sent through the air, for example by the wind

examples.text: The advertisement showed a group of horsemen on the beach, galloping through the sea spray.
A cloud of fine spray came up from the waterfall.
Spray flew up onto the rocks.
The boat sent a cloud of spray up behind it.
The skunk is capable of ejecting a spray of foul-smelling liquid.

definitions.definition: a substance that is forced out of a container such as an aerosol, in very small drops

examples.text: a can of insect spray *(= used to kill insects)*
a casserole dish sprayed with non-stick cooking spray

definitions.definition: a device or container, for example an aerosol, that you use to apply liquid in fine drops

examples.text: Use a spray to apply the weedkiller.

definitions.definition: an act of applying liquid to something in very small drops

examples.text: I gave the plants a quick spray.

definitions.definition: a small branch of a tree or plant, with its leaves and flowers or berries, that you use for decoration
an attractive arrangement of flowers or jewellery, that you wear

wordOrigin: noun senses 1 to 4 early 17th cent. (earlier as spry): related to Middle Dutch spra(e)yen ‘sprinkle’. noun senses 5 to 6 Middle English: representing late Old English (e)sprei, recorded in personal and place names, of unknown origin.
